skeletonlisp
Class Evaluator

java.lang.Object
  skeletonlisp.Evaluator

public class Evaluator
extends java.lang.Object

evaluator is used to transform user input L-expressions into their values.

Parameters:
_exit - holds the exit method.
Method Detail

eval

public LExp eval(LExp exp)
          throws java.lang.Exception
The method eval() is used to evaluate all L-expressions (SkeletonLisp-expressions).

LValues are returned as they are: they need not be evaluated further

LIDs are first LOOKed UP IN the globalEnvironment and the bound value is returned: if the Id is not found in theglobalEnvironment, it is LOOKed UP in PRIMITIVE list (primitiveApplier's lookupPrimitive()) and if not found there either, an exception is raised, otherwise the id itself is returned.

Lambdas are evaluated and returned as they are.

LApplications are applied with the apply()-method.

LConds are evaluated with the evalCond()-method.

Parameters:
exp - the expression to be evaluated.
Returns:
returns the value of exp.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Exception is thrown if, for any reason, exp cannot be evaluated.

evalArgs

public java.util.ArrayList<LExp> evalArgs(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> args)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
evalArgs is used to evaluate the arguments of an application when necessary.

There are a few primitives (AND and OR) that are Special Forms, and require their arguments to not be evaluated beforehand. Otherwise, with any other primitive, or with a lambda, a cond, or another application as the procedure part of an application, the argument values are always evaluated before they are applied to the procedure. Therefore, SkeletonLisp has a (mostly) strictly eager evaluation process.

Parameters:
args - the ArrayList of all the arguments of the application
Returns:
returns a new ArrayList with all the evaluated values of arguments.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if one (or more) arguments cannot be evaluated, for some reason.

evalCond

private LExp evalCond(LCond condExp)
               throws java.lang.Exception
The method evalCond() evaluates LCond-expressions. It evaluates every predicate of each of its' CondCases until one of them returns a value differing from NIL. When such value is found, the result of that particular CondCase is evaluated and returned as the result of the evaluation of the original LCond expression.

Parameters:
condExp - the LCond expression to be evaluated
Returns:
returns the first result of condExp's CondCases evaluated, whose predicate-part differs from NIL.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if either one of the predicates, or a result cannot be evaluated, or no predicate with a value differing from NIL is found.

apply

private LExp apply(LExp procedure,
                   java.util.ArrayList<LExp> argVals)
            throws java.lang.Exception
The method apply is used to evaluate applications.

Lambda procedures are evaluated by first evaluating all the argument values, and then using the method applyLambda().

Cond procedures are applied once again using apply() with the procedure substituted by the result of evaluating the Cond-procedure.

Applications are applied once again using apply() with the procedure substituted by the result of evaluating the application-procedure.

LIds are looked up in the globalEnvironment, and if found there, applied once again using apply() with the procedure substituted by the binding of the ID in the globalEnvironment.

Parameters:
procedure - the procedure of the application to be evaluated.
argVals - the argument values used with the procedure application.
Returns:
returns the result of applying argVals to procedure.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if either the procedure is not a proper procedure, or either at least one of the argVals cannot be evaluated, or applying the procedure to the argVals throws an Exception.

applyLambda

private LExp applyLambda(Lambda procedure,
                         java.util.ArrayList<LExp> evaledVals)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
the method applyLambda() is used to evaluate the result of a Lambda-procedure.

applyLambda expects its argumentValues to be evaluated before applyLambda() is called. In order to be able to evaluate the lambda body, it must be transformed into a new LExp by substituting all the lambda Variables that occur FREE in the lambda body, by the evaluated argument values given to applyLambda().

Afterwards, the result of evaluating the transformed body is returned.

A variable occurs free inside a body whenever it is not bound in the body. A variable is bound in the body, if it belongs inside a lambda-expression within the body with one of the the lambda expression's variables matching in its String representation the original variable:

The first x in the body of (lambda (x y) (or x ((lambda (x) (not x)) y))) is therefore free, but the second x is not free; the variable x in "(lambda (x) ..." binds it.

Parameters:
procedure - the Lambda-procedure that is to be applied.
evaledVals - the evaluated argument values of the Lambda application.
Returns:
returns the result of evaluating the lambda body after substituting all the FREE occuring lambda-variables within the body, with the corresponding argument values.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if the application is used with wrong number of argument values, or if the body cannot be evaluated for some reason.

transformLambdaBody

private LExp transformLambdaBody(LExp body,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<LId> vars,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<LExp> vals)
the method transformLambdaBody is used to substitute all the necessary free variables, within a lambda body, with their corresponding argument values. The transformation process depends completely on the type of the body:

If the body is an ID, it is substituted if and only if it is the same ID as any of the variables that are to be substituted.

if the body is a lambda, first all the original variables that match any of the variables of the body are removed from the list, along with the corresponding argument values, and only then all the variables that are left in the list, are substituted within the body of the new lambda-expression to their corresponding argument values.

if the body is an application, both the procedure part and all the application's arguments are transformed by the same rules using transformLambdaBody() with each, and afterwards a new application with the necessary substitutions made, is returned as a result.

if the body is a Cond-expression every single CondCase is transformed, and a new LCond consisting of the transformed CondCases, is returned as the result.

in any other case, the original body is returned as-is.

To transform a lambda's body, transformLambdaBody requires the variables and values to be clones of the original variables and values. If the var and val lists are not cloned, transformLambdaBody, could mutate the originals and thus produce garbage.

Parameters:
body - the lambda-body to be transformed
vars - the clones of the lambda-variables to be substitutes with their vals
vals - the clones of the vals to be substituted
Returns:
returns the transformed lambda body, where all the necessary variables have been substituted with their values.

applyPrimitive

private LExp applyPrimitive(LId procedure,
                            java.util.ArrayList<LExp> argVals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
The method applyPrimitive() evaluates the result of a primitive-procedure application with the given arguments. With all other primitives, but EXIT, AND and OR, it first evaluates all the argument values using the method evalArgs(), and then calls the approppriate PrimitiveApplier-method with the evaluated argument values. In the case of EXIT, applyPrimitive just calls the Runnable exit's run() method and then returns a farewell LString as it's value.

With AND and OR, the argument values are given as-is, to the approppriate PrimitiveApplier-methods.

Parameters:
procedure - the procedure of an application.
argVals - ArrayList of the argument values to be applied to procedure.
Returns:
returns a new LExp as a result of applying the given argument values to the given procedure.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Exception is thrown if the application cannot be evaluated, for some reason.

lookupIdInGlobalEnv

private LExp lookupIdInGlobalEnv(LId id)
the method lookupIdInGlobalEnvironment is used to look up the binding of an LId in globalEnvironment

Parameters:
id - an LId whose binding is to be returned
Returns:
returns the binding of id in globalEnvironment. If there is no binding for id, null is returned.
